content.label:
The app constantly has a 1 on it, indicating that I have a notification even when I don’t. This doesn’t change even when I do have a notification, so there’s no easy way to see if it’s my turn on a game if I miss the pop up notification. The result is that games often time out. 

If I am not actively in a game when it ends, there’s no way to see the results. It just disappears from my list as soon as it ends. 

The chat resets every time I minimize the app on my phone which makes it pretty much impossible to use. It would be nice for it to keep messages for the duration of the game.
The UI on this version is not good and makes it frustrating to play. If you enjoyed the old app, I don’t think you will this version.

Due to unfortunate circumstances I lost access to the old version which as most of you know is an absolute masterpiece. I miss the music and simplicity and the true to board game design of the original. Had I not experienced the code monkeys version I would of rated this current desecration a solid 2 or maybe 3. They took the soul out of this game and replaced it with something manufactured and hollow.

title.label: Doesn’t deserve all the negative reviews

content.label:
I bought this game with some trepidation after seeing all the negative revues but I have had no problems with it at all. I feel like a lot of people were really attached to the original Carc app (which I never used) and so they are unfairly down on this one.

The graphics are great. The game plays smoothly, the controls are easy to use, it has a lot of features that I really like like farm highlighting. The AIs are challenging at different levels. I haven’t had any trouble with online play or setting up a game against my wife. 

A lot of people have complained about the game just ending when the time you set at the beginning runs out. That sounds really annoying but I just always set it to the max (14 days or something) and it hasn’t been a problem. 

All in all I love Carcassonne as a board game and I really like how it was implemented here as an app.

Good enough interpretation of Carcassonne to be very fun and enjoyable.

PROBLEM
The computer gets stuck “thinking” forever sometimes during the river tile laying period. Only way out is to force quit.  You might want to try a timeout.  You surely have enough analytics to register and solve all these bugs, it’s not like you aren’t logging every single thing we do in the app. Please fix this is so annoying. Playing against Conqueror with Inns and Cathedrals, River (obviously), and abbot.

title.label: Old app from coding monkeys significantly better

content.label: Gonna just boycott asmodee products now for ruining two great apps.

In my original post, I rated this one star for the many reasons others did too. I can back to raise that to a two maybe three star, only to find out my review is gone. Deleted. Hidden so others can’t see it. Hence, I stand by my one star review.

title.label: I might just use the table top version

content.label: I might just use the table top version it is sooooooooooo much better
Would be better if less time wasted drawing pretty graphics.  Gameplay is excruciatingly slow.

title.label: What a piece of doo doo

content.label: I have played more than 25 times and now suddenly can’t log in, cannot reset password, cannot play. Is this some kind of scam to get us to pay over and over again?

The Princess and the Dragon is unplayable! You get halfway through the game and it freezes to the point where you can no longer play any tiles. Please fix or refund my money, I would love to be able to play this as it’s my favorite expansion! The rest of the game isn’t too bad, but please work on this!
The game was so simple and elegant under The Coding Monkeys direction.  This version is clunky and slow with all the corny animations.  Please renew your contract with the coding monkeys.

title.label: Give the license back to The Coding Monkeys!

content.label:
The game’s timer has caused me to lose twice! The first time, it subtracted way more time than I’d actually spent, and it timed me out even though I hadn’t run out the full 15 minutes! The next time, the game was in the middle of scoring, but it hadn’t stopped my clock (which again, was running too fast), and the clock ran out in the middle of scoring so it automatically recorded a loss for me. The camera always pans away from the full board when someone places a tile. I’m constantly adjusting the camera so I can see the board after I’ve placed my tile. Why do I want to stare at my just-placed tile until the other player places theirs? I don’t. This interpretation of the game is just not as clean and nice and simple and functional as the previous version.

As a side note, I bought this game on Nintendo Switch as well. I was excited to play Carcassonne online there ... but, no dice! There is no online!
Don’t believe the negative reviews.

This game loads so slowly that a 15-20min game takes 60-90min.

I paid Extra money so that I could go extra slow and eventually get to a point where I could not play at all. Even after restarting the app waiting an entire day. I demand a refund
The whole reason I bought the app was to play with my mom remotely, but the servers can't be connected to, so... entirely a waste of $5.

I keep running into issues where I set the timer to the max but the game starts and everyone only has a few minutes to play. It’s timed out before we could finish and we were all pretty attentive. I also keep losing games that I’d already started/waiting on someone to accept an invite. 

I also choose a main meeple color and rarely ever start with the one I selected. 

Lastly, no matter what, I always have a badge notification on the app icon even if I don’t have a game going. 

Huge fan of the game otherwise. Would love to see more expansions.
The previous version of Carcassonne available on the App Store is superior in every way to this new version. Very disappointed in the change.

I switched from the old version. This is terrible - just like others said. Save the money and find a new game to play!

My main issue: poor design in terms of usability and readability. I use an iPhone and it’s difficult to see upcoming tiles, scores, and leftover meeples. Fonts are too small, color contrast is poor. Usage is clumsy. It’s written without consideration of different platforms and basic rules of designing good human interfaces.

I saw other comments about ‘old’ users liking their ways ... this is just plain arrogant. Listen to the criticism and make it fun and playable. The old app certainly was!

I forfeit my first game, deleted the app I just paid for  but will check back in a six months. If it is the same, that was it for me and I will have to congratulate the developers on successfully having killed a beautiful thing.

title.label: AI is super slow to play with add-ons equipped

content.label: Just as the title indicates, the AI is really slow to play if you equip much in terms of the add-ons. I have a pretty new iPad and it's still a problem.

title.label: New To Carcassonne and This is Perfect

content.label:
TL;DR - If you are new to Carcassonne and want to hone your skills or learn, this is a 5 star game, period. I’m in that boat, so my review as follows is from that POV:

I’m new to the game (literally played the board game for the first time last night) and obviously seen the light! But I don’t know how often, especially in quarantine, I’m going to get games together, and I really want to increase my skill. As I was playing I could tell there were strategies to be had and plays to be made but I wasn’t skilled enough to see them yet. This app is perfect for that.

Gameplay: The AI is fast, unsure the complaints from others (maybe with a lot of expansions? I don’t know).

The gameplay is super intuitive. The animation is a nice touch, and the ability to visualize fields is a life saver. Also little things like squares that become forever unplayable being highlighted opened up my eyes to that as a tactic I had never considered. 

For all those that say this looks “cheap” you realize the game in real life is cardboard and block meeples right? This isn’t going to look like that, the material is different. I get that people love their original artwork and this community is up there with comic book and Star Wars fans when demanding things be a certain way - but just understand the translation of the board game to an app in looks just doesn’t work as a 1:1 mirror. So with that in mind, I think the developers made smart creative decisions, which they had to.

As a new player, this rules, thanks for the great app.
Game is buggy, most content is locked and requires further purchase. Shameful...

title.label: I think it’s a lot of fun

content.label:
This is a great game though I don’t think end game scoring of roads is correct. Sometimes it gives one point per incomplete other times the incomplete road scores 0. 

Can’t figure out a pattern. Other than that - great game. 5 stars once the road scoring Is fixed. 

Another nit. I bought all expansions. But winter is a waste. It limits the game to only that version. Would be nice to incorporate with other expansions.

title.label: Works great. Lots of fun. Pretty layout.

content.label:
I think many reviews here are bitter about a previous app which no longer exists. I started playing table top Carcassone last week for the first time. Then bought the app a day later. I don’t know the old app. But this one is good and worth paying a couple of dollars for.

You can play against a very good AI, the last one of the four is very tough (at least for me) - the others easier. You can play online against other players which also worked well for me. I didn’t notice any lag as some complained about.  

A brief tutorial for the first time player might be helpful when facing other humans. I’m still not sure what the icons in the game selection menu really mean and I have no idea what the ranking points are and how to gain or lose them. I’m also not sure if those games or with abbot and river or just standard. I didn’t buy any of the other expansions yet.

In sum, I like it. I almost wouldn’t have bought it because of the reviews. But they seem to be more about other stuff than the app itself.

title.label: Awful. Please Support Original Carcassone Developers - Coding Monkeys

content.label: A small independent game developer once made a great rendition of this classic game. They were called Coding Monkeys. Please do not buy this game. This version by Asmodee looks like a clunky mishmash freemium feel of a timeless game. This the freemium version of Monopoly.

To play with a friend:
Both be online in the one global chatroom for the whole game.
Search in the chat for their name while they’re online.
Find and Favorite them.
Now go to create online game and select them.

There is also some kind of arbitrary time limit on games. I haven’t successfully played a single full game in weeks of trying and think I’ll just delete the game now.

It’s a waste of money and a horrible user experience compared to the previous company’s version.

This problem has got to be fixed straight wavy: you cannot see the whole board at once, once the board’s grown to substantial size.
Zooming out to see the entire board not supported.  You can only zoom out to a view of larger boards that takes in perhaps a third of the board. 
The alternative 3D display gives an oddly angled view of the board that still leaves some portions out.
Scrolling the view not easy and smooth.
Kludgy graphics display is cluttered with distracting flags and movement in completed cities.
There is needless variance in city tiles of the same value or type; some city tiles with 3 field sides and one city side have a thin portion of the tile depicting the city; some have a thicker portion, for no good reason.
I like a nice, clean visual presentation, one that is easily manipulated and consistent, and this is not that.

I’m a huge fan of the board game and the previous app from Coding Monkeys.  I took a chance on this for more cross platform gaming experience.   

Make this better:  
1.  For local games, speed up the AI... 
2.  For online games, retain full chat history... chat feature should be fully saved from start to stop... it currently clears every time you leave a slow play online game 
3.  Fix the graphics ... too busy so it is difficult to see key features.  Something just makes this much more difficult to understand and see versus competitor version 
4.  Menus and prompts are confusing ... when leaving an online slow play game, I hit return to main menu... it asked me if I was quitting.... very confusing as it implied forfeit 
5.  Add on notifications for slow play online  games if competitor doesn’t make a move within a day

Good improvement:
1. Fields toggle is nice... props for that!

A focus on the interface outside of a game and on the in game graphics will go a long ways towards making this a winner.

My old iPad recently died and took the old version of Carcassonne (by the coding monkeys) with it. I could have cried. It was my favourite app of all time.
In comparison this version looks cheap. The design and colours are unappealing. The tile design lacks the charm and interest of the old version and so is just less pleasant to play overall.
The gameplay is clunky and further slowed by unnecessary and painfully slow zooms at each turn (seriously, just let me pick a size for the board and zoom in as needed to place game pieces...this is excruciating). 
It’s impossible to play at a brisk pace because the board is constantly zooming and moving unnecessarily, to the point that it gives you a headache. But then perversely you can’t zoom out far enough to see the whole board the larger it gets.
The animations are distracting and again slow down gameplay. 
I haven’t yet tried to play online, as I can barely get through a standard game it’s so clunky...but from what I hear from friends it’s a disaster.
I bought every single expansion on the the old app and loved what they added to the gameplay, but I won’t be spending another cent on this until things are significantly improved. In fact, I might even try to get my money back as this game is so frustrating as to be almost unplayable.   
Seriously, learn from the old app. It’s not about nostalgia, it’s about good design and better gameplay.
It’s sad. I really, REALLY wanted to like this version...

title.label: Far too busy for the eye

content.label: Too much trying to happen. The previous designer of the online version had it right; simple, clean, not too much animation. Trying to play this hurts my head. And it doesn’t have all the expansions he previous adaption had.

It takes awhile to get used to this version of Carcassonne.  Yes it’s a bit more animated, and definitely not as esoteric or pure as the original. But it’s very nice once you get used to it.  I can understand why they recharge for expansions, after all it’s a very different work.   Open your mind and try it for awhile; give it a chance.  I’ve only used solo playing against AI so cannot attest to online play.
Can’t even log in now. This is trash. It needs to be taken down from the AppStore

The old Carcassonne app was infinitely superior. This app requires you to respond to a phantom email in order to confirm registration but this is impossible because the email never arrives. There is no help available. There is no way to generate a replacement email. The app lets me send chat messages to other users but does not let me connect  with them to play. So basically it doesn’t work.
Also the visual layout is overly busy and clumsy.

title.label: Slow AI and Slow Gameplay All Around

content.label:
I already miss TheCodingMonkeys version of this app. It was so much better. This version has too much “flair” and too many little animations and it slows the game play down. When you play against the computer it takes 3-5 seconds “thinking” every turn. Not a fan of this version. Plus I have to buy all the DLC again, Asmodee saw $$$ and released a crap app. And why does this crappy app keep showing me badges on the icon as if it’s my turn when it is not? I’m going to miss TheCodingMonkeys version :(

A great app just got replaced with a crappy app.

Crap crap crap!

title.label: Previous game developer was much better

content.label: This version of the game is super slow and the design is muddy and over saturated in color. The previous designers of the game provided much quicker game play and the design was cleaner without distortions. I won’t play this version of the game.

I have played this version on my pc while playing the former iOS game on my iPad and iPhone.  I have always preferred this game to the other, and I was looking forward to its release in the App Store.

I know everyone has their own preferences, but I don’t think this game is as bad as many of the reviews indicate. I really enjoy playing it and I’m glad to finally see it available for iOS!

title.label: Don’t buy if you have played the real game. THIS IS A SHAMELESS MONEY GRAB!

content.label:
The app is a shallow copy of the real game. It’s like it has been dumb down because they thought people could understand strategy.

I am truly disappointed with this purchase.

Compared to the old version, by Coding Monkeys, this is so much slower, clunkier, and more complicated. Real shame the Carcassonne app lost licensing - it’s probably one of my longest running apps I consistently use. If you have it, don’t bother with this one, even if you’re just curious like I was.

Lots of reviews are pretty harsh for a game that works pretty well, is a good adaptation, and looks decent.  I’ve been playing single player and online with family and enjoyed both.  Yes there is room for improvement but give them a chance to address the issues. 

Pros - good adaptation of actual game, intuitive interface, overall good art, AI keeps single player interesting, you can play with your friends online, you can set time limits such that playing with friends can essentially be turn based so games can go over many days, features like showing fields and tiles left is fun, seems only host of online game needs expansions for everyone to play expansion

Cons - needs a recap feature because if you aren’t online at the end you can’t see how an online game ended, the chat in online play disappears every time you leave so you can’t have a dialogue, sometimes takes a moment to connect or disconnects but not terribly so, wish you could turn specific features in expansions on and off (e.g. use builder but not pig or just use tiles from expansions but not other mechanics), can only add friends to friends list if they are online. 

Overall I’ve enjoyed both the single and online play. Absolutely worth the cost if you enjoy the board game.
The AI painfully slow on single player.

This app replaces simple, functional design, with unnecessary 3d graphics, excruciating load times,  constant login issues (they changed my username with no notification! Why!?!?!), and an abysmal UI. 

Game logs you out every time you close it.  I have to change my password about half the time because it doesn't recognize it anymore.

The in-game view is at a side angle, not top down, making it difficult to see info on the board that is critical to playing the game. I realize this view is for the 3d, but why do i care about 3d if it makes the game hard to play? Im sure the graphics also have an affect on load time. I looked for a down res option, but there is only “normal” and some enhanced version that I forget the name of. They should call it “the even slower option.”

Your friends have to be searched through a chat, and they must be online with the game active on their screen. Even then, individual users are difficult to find.  

This all adds up to a massively frustrating experience. Im only still using it because some of my friends didn't get to the previous app before it was too late. I’d be furious if I’d paid more than $5. We were going to switch to Ticket To Ride, but saw that app is also from Asmodee. No way are they getting another dime of my money.

The 3-D view makes it hard to see what’s going on. And waiting for the computers to take their turn is painfully slow.  Just wait.  And wait.  And wait. 

I play the old Carcassonne app a lot. Going to switch back to that until this is tuned up
Like newer version. Much easier to play.

This rendition of Carcassonne is inferior in every way to the version it replaced. The old version was better the day it was released than this will ever be.

- No Game Center integration. Instead you must give Asmodee your e-mail address. Hmmm... why would they want that? Maybe to spam me in the hopes of money? Track me and sell information about me to, well, whoever?
- Want an expansion pack (even if you owned the old version)? Give Asmodee your e-mail address.
- Everything about the new version screams "design by committee," from the busy artwork, to the awkward gameplay, to the blaring sound and music. Probably because someone wanted a bigger cut of the pie for themselves and less for the developers.

No sane human being would replace what they had with this unless there was significant money in it for them.

We love the board game and the app didn’t disappoint! I never played the old app so I can’t compare the two but I think this one plays great. It’s recently released so I am sure it will only get better with time! We haven’t run into any issues and I’ve played local and online with friends.

name.label: give us back the old version

title.label: Pretty, and I would love to be able to play it

content.label: We had the old app and it was fantastic - unfortunately, the new app is not great. The app is clunky, loads super slowly, and doesn’t show other players’ moves - including the end game results... our friends frequently play and have to figure out over text who won! Not great.

title.label: Same as the slow android version

content.label:
I complained back in Dec 2018 when there was an Android update. My reward was the AI play going from fast to senior center  speed (I’m a senior). This version is better than no version.
Pros- Color coded fields.
           Normal and high quality video selection in settings (high for    larger screens).
           
Cons- No ghost meeble add-on.
            No human player selection for local play with others.

This is Carcassonne. Likely you used the other app. The only draw for this iteration, it seems, is poorly implemented 3D for details on the tiles. Note, the tiles themselves remain 2D. It’s just features like buildings and farm plots that receive the 3D treatment. All DLC must be repurchased, making this a $20 cash grab for the whole thing. Very disappointed. At the very least they could have allowed registered players to restore 3D. You are getting a very negligible graphics upgrade for 4.99-20+ price tag. If that’s your thing, you’ll want to buy it. If you want a great implementation of the game in 2D, stick with the original. Embarrassingly greedy, Asmodee.

title.label: Much worse than the version it replaces

content.label: It’s a shame that the old publisher lost their ability to make this game. This version is significantly worse. The simple mechanic of placing a tile isn’t even good. You can’t drag tiles. The meeple placing screen is too busy. Overall this version is a major downgrade. Very disappointed.

title.label: A Sad Day for the Kingdom of Carcassonne

content.label:
The old Carcassonne app, which thankfully I still have, was a masterpiece. It led the way for amazing board games on iPad. Everything was thoughtfully done, and it was extremely popular and well-loved.

By comparison, this app is a joke. The new 3D graphics are nice (if a bit jagged) at first but distract from the game and make it quite uncomfortable to play on larger boards; the multiplayer is unreliable (which problem Asmodee Digital seems to repeat with each game so far); the interface and translations are poor. The beautiful art, music, sound design, and voiceover are gone, replaced by thoughtless content from a seat-of-the-pants dev shop.

It is the end of an era. A great app bites the dust and is replaced by a poor one. A sad day for the kingdom of Carcassonne.
